quality_assessment: Comprehensive and accurate documentation with excellent visual diagrams and practical examples. All major git integration features are well-documented and match the implementation.
positive_aspects: Excellent use of Mermaid diagrams for worktree lifecycle and branch tracking flows
MkDocs Material admonitions used effectively (tips, warnings, notes)
Code annotations explain YAML configuration inline (numbered annotations)
Accurate documentation of commit_required with PRODIGY_NO_COMMIT_VALIDATION bypass
Correct merge variable documentation (merge.worktree, merge.source_branch, merge.target_branch, merge.session_id)
MapReduce worktree isolation clearly documented with hierarchy diagram
Orphaned worktree recovery workflow well-explained with CLI commands
Real-world examples for feature branch workflows and CI validation
Source code references point to correct files and line numbers
improvement_suggestions: Add cross-reference links to related pages (mapreduce/checkpoint-and-resume.md, advanced/storage.md)
Consider adding troubleshooting section for common git merge conflict scenarios
Could mention the WorktreeStatus enum values (InProgress, Completed, Merged, CleanedUp, Failed, Abandoned, Interrupted) for advanced users
Consider adding example output showing what the worktree ls command returns

worktree_state.notes: WorktreeState struct correctly documents original_branch tracking, WorktreeStatus enum matches states shown in mermaid diagram

commit_required.notes: head_before capture and commit verification logic matches documentation

PRODIGY_NO_COMMIT_VALIDATION.notes: Environment variable correctly documented as skip_validation flag

merge_variables.notes: merge.source_branch and merge.target_branch used in execute_merge_workflow

commit_validation_error.notes: Error message 'No changes were committed by [command]' matches documentation

metadata.validation_focus: Auto-discovered page - check for drift and enhance with visual features
